DOC.brief_title: Educational Program Younger Women Who Have Recently Finished Treatment Stage I Stage II Breast Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Design , implement , evaluate educational intervention nutrition education intervention specifically aim improving adjustment among young woman newly diagnose treated stage I II breast cancer end active phase treatment . - Determine process intervention affect quality life . - Assess whether intervention differentially effective different group woman . - Determine woman decline participation differ participate . - Determine nature extent adjustment difficulty , use baseline data , young woman live urban set treat early stage breast cancer . - Identify personality situational correlate individual adapt well early-stage breast cancer diagnosis treatment . OUTLINE : This randomize study . Patients randomize 1 2 intervention group control condition . - Arm I ( control group ) : Patients undergo intervention . Patients evaluate baseline 4 13 month . - Arm II ( breast cancer education group ) : Patients attend series approximately 2-hour-long breast cancer education group session month 4 month . Sessions involve presentation information concern breast cancer , follow guided discussion relate topic . Sessions topic include : talk child cancer , life diagnosis , relationships/intimacy , hormone breast cancer/basic factor heredity . Patients also give booklet brochures read home . Patients evaluated baseline , immediately intervention , 9 month intervention . - Arm III ( nutritional education group ) : Patients attend series approximately 2-hour-long nutritional education group session month 4 month . Sessions involve presentation information concern nutrition , follow guided discussion relate topic . Session topic include : healthy cupboard , 's cooking , shop success , town . Patients also ask keep 4 day record diet . Patients evaluated baseline , immediately intervention , 9 month intervention .
